p.span: Prescott Unified School District
Information Sheet About School Closures
About the virus that causes COVID-19

According to the Center for Disease Control (CDC), the COVID-19 virus causes a respiratory illness ranging from a mild cold-like illness to severe pneumonia. Signs and symptoms include a fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure. Although there is a slight risk of catching the disease from another person before symptoms appear, people are most contagious when they are the most symptomatic or sickest. It is spread between people who are in close contact with one another and through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes. Older adults and people who have severe underlying chronic medical conditions like heart or lung disease or diabetes are at a much higher risk for developing serious complications. According to the CDC, there is no evidence that children are more susceptible. In fact, most confirmed cases of COVID-19 reported from China have occurred in adults. You can find additional information regarding COVID-19 symptoms at the CDC website.
Preventative Measures When Schools Reopen

The public is encouraged to follow basic hygiene practices. PUSD classrooms were disinfected over Spring Break using an electrostatic process that kills all bacteria and viruses. The following are additional preventative measures that we have put into place to assist with the minimization of the risk of contracting many illnesses that spread from person-to-person:

li.span: Disinfecting of learning, eating, play spaces, buses, and restrooms.
Aligned with CDC guidelines, we have implemented additional cleaning measures focused on

p.span: disinfecting main touchpoints such as detailing doorknobs, light switches, handles, tables, school buses, etc.

li.span: Providing soap, paper towels, tissues, and additional resources in all school health offices.
Reminding students to wash hands frequently, avoid touching eyes, nose or mouth, and to cover coughs and sneezes.
Classroom teachers, counselors and staff will be educating students on the

p.span: importance of handwashing to prevent the spread of viruses. Students will be
allowed extra time for washing their hands throughout the day. Teachers are
encouraged to use strategies to minimize student touch/interactions.

li.span: Employees are following proper preventative measures and are required to stay home

p.span: when sick.
How Does the Health Department Decide When to Close Schools?
CDC is recommending using the model in the link below when deciding to close schools and to
flatten the curve. Note- Yavapai County does not have a curve yet as no cases have been reported
Changes to District and School-Sponsored Events
Based on CDC recommendations, all school related events have been cancelled.

We will be updating our PUSD families with any changes in these types of events including field trips, athletics, activities, assemblies, travel, try-outs,practices. We will also review all extracurricular activities including musical, dance, drama performances; school-wide assemblies, award events, large group student and public activities;fundraising events; parent group sponsored events and activities; and any other school events and
activities where large groups are gathered, both on the school campus or outside of the school.
Absences, for School Closure
Aligned with the Arizona Department of Education, our schools will work with students who
experience prolonged absences. This may include providing additional time and flexibility to
make up work. Students will not be penalized for an absence from school. We ask that you
carefully follow your healthcare provider’s recommendations.
Continuing Learning at Home During School Closures

Our teachers are eager to continue learning at home with students. They are highly qualified and ready to implement this new approach with district instructional coaches and leadership. Our approach will be two-fold providing first short-term optional learning activities to do at home while developing a long-term solution for continued classroom instruction should this closure be prolonged

li.span: Teachers and instructional coaches are currently developing at home short-term and long-term learning activities. Look for guidance on this in the next couple days
We will also follow anticipated state guidelines on issues such as mandatory days of instruction, any possible extended school year, and high school credit requirements.
PHS dual credit and AP courses will continue online tomorrow. Students in these courses will be hearing from their teachers regarding continued classwork.

p.span: it is important to know that this learning will look and feel different and that students and parents should reach out to teachers directly when there are questions about student learning at home. Our goal is to make this as smooth as possible for families.
Meals for Children During School Closure

Free daily food service for children aged 18 and under will be available at PUSD schools starting tomorrow, Tuesday, March 17. Families are invited to pick up a bagged breakfast and/or lunch or at Lincoln School or Prescott High School. Drive-up meal pickup will be available Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Children do not need to be in the vehicle to receive meals.
Athletics
As you all know there are updates with the COVID-19 virus daily. The State of Arizona and Prescott Unified School District has implemented a safety plan to help prevent the spread of COVID-19.

The Prescott High School Athletic Department has been instructed to suspend all athletic competitions through March 28th, per AIA Executive Board and PUSD administration determination. Effective immediately, please adhere to the following until further notice:

li.span: No athletic team meetings or gatherings
Immediate closure of Prescott High School weight room, gym, courts and fields for staff, students, adult volunteers and rental groups.

p.span: As you know this situation is quickly evolving and there will be more communication as we move forward. If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact
via email

Spring sports seasons for GMS and PMHMS are cancelled. The AIA has cancelled all statewide high school sports competitions for the next two weeks, with the remainder of the season to be evaluated by the AIA thereafter. Scenarios for continuing high school team practices in small groups are under review.
Events
Group practices and performances for school fine arts and other events planned for the next two weeks are cancelled.
Testing
We will follow upcoming state direction on all standardized testing this year. The state plans to request a waiver from the federal government on mandatory testing for this year.
Prescott High School Genesis Program

Students enrolled in the Genesis program can continue to work on coursework in the PLP program without interruption. We encourage students to maintain a routine and continue working towards their goal of graduating from Prescott High School.

The Arizona Department of Education is requiring all Online and DRP programs, such as Genesis, continue to operate in a remote capacity. This means students will still need to achieve satisfactory monthly progress as they do every month of the year, but that the lab will not be open until further notice. We will continue to communicate with Genesis students and families regarding the lab and final exams.
If students need anything regarding their coursework please contact Mr. Dean at:
at any time. We will work diligently to solve any issues students may have.
Following State Guidelines

We will also follow anticipated state guidelines on issues such as mandatory days of instruction, any possible extended school year, and high school credit requirements. Currently, we plan to hold Prescott High School graduation in the traditional format on our planned date. We will only adjust if this becomes mandated by the state. We recognize that this is a completely unprecedented situation, and we will be as flexible as we can be, based on how circumstances unfold.
Helpful Links
